question:
Which among the following statements is/are correct about snowfall?
  1. It occurs when condensation takes place above freezing point.
  2. Precipitation occurs in forms of fine flakes of snow.
Select the correct code from the options given below:
explanation:
Condensation of water vapor in air in form of water droplets or ice is called Precipitation.
Precipitation occurs in the form of:
  • Snowfall
  • Sleet
  • Hail
  • Rainfall
Snowfall is when condensation takes place below freezing point. Precipitation occurs in forms of fine flakes of snow
